III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Eligibility requirements.
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
Section • (3) An independent living home, staffed and
Description operated by the child placing agency, must be
clean, safe, and appropriate
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is a concern that mold in the facility's basement
causing youth to become sick.
Investigation This complaint came in anonymous therefore no reporting source
interview.
Youth A was interviewed at the independent living home on
1/26/2024 via video. DHHS Worker was present for the interview.
Youth A reported that he has lived at the independent living home
since January 18, 2023. He reported that he likes living in the
home alone but with people around. He reported he does not have
to worry about being homeless and discussed how he aged out of
foster care. Youth A discussed the program rules, curfew and how
to contact staff if needed. He reported all youth are provided a
contact list with staff names and telephone numbers for
emergencies. He reported all youth living in the home are
provided door keys upon entering the program and when the
youth lose their key, they are provided another key. Youth A
discussed how Youth B always loses his key and pounds on his
window and the door when he loses his key to be let into the
home especially after curfew. He reported he does not like Youth
B pounding on his window and he has reported this behavior to
the staff but so far, nothing has happened with Youth B and Youth
B constantly loses his key and does not follow program protocol.
Youth A was questioned about getting sick in the home due to
mold, has he observed mold in the home and has he reported
seeing mold in the home to staff. Youth A reported he has never
observed mold in the home, he has never got sick due to mold
and he is usually in the home every day.
Youth B was interviewed on 1/26/2024 by the DHHS Worker He
reported he was placed in the home on 10/10/2023. He said he
always loses his key, and he bangs on Youth A’s window and the
door to be let into the home. He did not deny breaking curfew,
smoking marijuana in the home and bringing in girls which is not
2

allowed. He said he brings his girlfriend into the home, and he is
aware this is against the rules. He reported when he breaks
curfew or doesn’t follow the rules, the supervisor or staff will talk to
him. He reported the program always has staff except on the
weekends where there is no staff during the day. In regard to the
allegation, Youth B reported he has no idea about any mold in the
home. He denied seeing any mold or hearing about anyone being
sick from mold. He reported he does not go into the basement
and that no one goes in the basement to his knowledge.
Youth C was interviewed on 2/6/2024 via video with a DHHS
Worker. Youth C was placed in the program on 10/31/23. Youth C
reported he did not know about any mold in the basement or
anyone getting sick from mold. He said he has been in the
basement and there was no mold. He said he has seen mold
before on food in the refrigerator when it is not thrown out timely.
Program Manager was interviewed on 1/26/2024 via video
conference with a DHHS Worker. She reported she just returned
to this position in early January and to her knowledge, there is no
mold issue.
Supervisor was interviewed via video on 1/26/2024. He reported
on Saturday the house has first and third shift staff present but not
second shift staff. He reported during the week the house have
1st, 2nd and 3rd shift staff. He explained that each youth has a key
and is provided staff contact list for on call workers in case of
emergencies as well as to call 911 if any potential danger occurs
and staff is not available. Supervisor reported that no one is
allowed in the home and the youth know that, so he is not sure
where the mold accusation came from. He said there is no mold
in the home. Supervisor reported that the landlord had the home
inspected in November 2023 and the home passed. He said he
has been in the basement and there is no mold. He reported the
basement is used for storage and the youth do not go in the
basement. The Supervisor denied anyone reporting to him they
were sick from mold or that mold was present in the home. He
said the staff are not hired to clean therefore it’s up to the youth to
clean their areas.
Youth Specialist was interviewed on 2/6/2024 via video with a
DHHS Worker. She reported she has never been in the basement
and the basement area is not someplace where the youth or staff
usually go. She said it is used for storage. She denied hearing
about mold in the home or anyone getting sick from mold. She
said the youth are assigned chores and there is a chore list that
3

the youth use to know what area they are assigned to clean. She
said the chore list helps the youth to make sure the house is
clean. She said the youth are not always cleaning their area when
the areas are supposed to be clean.
The DHHS Worker completed an inspection of the basement, and
this Consultant viewed the basement area per video with the
assistance of the DHHS Worker. The basement had storage of
various holiday items and boxes. It was a Michigan basement and
had a rocky bottom in some areas. The basement was dry. The
DHHS Worker said the basement was dusty with no moisture or
musky smell. There was no mold viewed anywhere in the
basement.
The DHHS Worker completed a house inspection, and this
Consultant viewed the inspection per video. There was no mold in
the refrigerator, some left over food, but it was not moldy.
Bathrooms upper and bottom floors were observed, there was no
mold in the showers, on the shower curtains or in the sinks.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Youth A, Youth B, Youth C case records in MiSACWIS to
verify placement dates.
• Reviewed DHHS Worker contact with Youth B.
• City Inspection report for the Onyx house at 703 W. Cedar
Street in Kalamazoo Michigan dated 12/27/2023:
Basement cannot be used for habitation.
Conditions found that need to be met by 5/1/24.
• Items stored in basement could be sensitive to
moisture damage and should be stored in airtight
containers.
• Damage to the door entering the basement.
• Water noted entering the basement.
• Exhaust fan not operating properly in lower
bathroom.
• Upper bathroom floor has some damage.
• Siding of home has damage, paint is peeling.
Remove and replace peeling paint and any rotting
wood.
• Side deck soffit is damage.
• First floor den has damaged or stained carpet.
• First floor office (staff) has stain on the ceiling.
• Upper hallway has stained or frayed carpet.
Certification expires on 3/30/26 as long as the conditions have
been met.
4

Analysis All of the youth placed in the program and the staff interviewed
denied mold was in the home. An inspection was completed in
December 2023 did not mention mold in any parts of the home.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
